include_impedance.description: logical switches for defining which impedance factors to consider in the assessment

engineering.description: flag to include engineering mobilization and design delays

contractor.description: flag to include contractor mobilization delays

long_lead.description: flag to include long lead delays

system_design_time.description: variables of formula to calculate median system design time

f.description: design fee ratio: ratio of building value charged by engineering firm. Default to 0.04 for repair projects

r.description: engineering rate: Average hourly rate of engineering work. Default to $175 per hour

t.description: team factor: accounts for parallel time between multiple designers spent on project. Default to 1.3

w.description: average workday: average number of hours per day spent on project: Default to 8 hours

eng_design_min_days.description: Minumum number of days for the median engineering design time

eng_design_max_days.description: Maximum number of days for the median engineering design time

mitigation.description: general impedance assessment inputs such as mitigation factors

is_essential_facility.description: is the building deemed as essential by the local jurisdiction

is_borp_equivalent.description: are the BORP, or BORP equivalent, post-earthquake strategies in place to limit inspection delays

is_engineer_on_retainer.description: is an engineer contracted to be on retainer in case of post-earthquake damage

contractor_relationship.description: string identifier that defines the state of existing relationships with contractors to perform repairs. Options include <'retainer', 'good', 'none'>

contractor_retainer_time.description: time, in days, from onset of damage to when repairs start previosly agreed upon in retainer agreement. Only applies when 'retainer' contractor_relationship is selected

funding_source.description: what is the source of funding for repair costs beyond that of the capital of the owner

capital_available_ratio.description: ratio of the building value that the onwer has immediately available for repairs

impedance_truncation.description: Truncation bounds of lognormal distribution of impedance time, input as the number of standard deviations above and below the mean. Default to 2

default_lead_time.description: Lead time, in days, to replace select components (equipment or other less readily available components). This default lead time will be applied to all components with the long_lead flag in the inputs builder. To add custom lead times per component, update the long_lead_time attribute in the damage.comp_ds_table field.

demand_surge.description: general user input options for defining the demand surge

include_surge.description: include demand surge when simulating impedance times

is_dense_urban_area.description: is within a dense urban area, typically defined by a site within a metropolitan statistical area (MSA) with a population of over 1 million

site_pga.description: peak ground acceleration (PGA) in g at the building site for the ground shaking intensity of interest

pga_de.description: peak ground acceleration (PGA) in g associated with the design eartquake (DE). Method of combining ground motion pairs (e.g., max direction vs geomean) should match the field site_pga

scaffolding_lead_time.description: The number of days it takes to get workers to the site to erect scaffolding

scaffolding_erect_time.description: The number of days it takes for workers to errect scaffolding to protect doorways and walkways from falling hazards

door_racking_repair_day.description: days after the earthquake required to unjam all racked doorways

flooding_cleanup_day.description: days after the earthquake required to shut off leaks and dry out water

temp_repair_beta.description: lognormal uncetainty of temporary repair times. Default to 0.6

max_workers_per_sqft_story.description: Maximum density of workers on a given story. Default to 0.001 from FEMA P-58

max_workers_per_sqft_building.description: Maximum density of workers for the entire building after the first 10. Default to 0.00025 from REDi

max_workers_building_min.description: Lower limit on the maximum number of workers for the entire building (i.e., max number of workers is never less than this). Default to 20 from REDi

max_workers_building_max.description: Upper limit on the maximum number of workers for the entire building (i.e., max number of workers is never more than this). Default to 260 from REDi

allow_tmp_repairs.description: Flag to allow temporay repair measures to be used to restore building reoccupancy and basic function

allow_shoring.description: Flag to allow shoring to be used as a temporary repair for mitigating local structural stability issues. Setting allow_tmp_repairs to zero overwrites this flag

calculate_red_tag.description: flag to indicate whether or not to include the assessment of red tags based on component damage

red_tag_clear_time.description: days after all red tag repairs are done before occupancy can be regained (i.e. time for permitting office to clear the tag)

red_tag_clear_beta.description: lognormal dispersion defining the uncertaitny in the red tag clear time

include_local_stability_impact.description: flag to consider the effect of local structural stability issues (that would require shoring) on building occupancy

egress_threshold.description: ratio of building egress paths required for building safety and access

fire_watch.description: will a fire watch be set if fire sprinkler systems are damaged

local_fire_damamge_threshold.description: ratio of building fire sprinkler branches or drops that can be damaged with a given story without significantly disrupting the operation of the active fire supression system

min_egress_paths.description: minimum number of egress pathways that must be maintained at each story to maintain occupancy

required_ratio_operating_hvac_main.description: ratio of hvac units, which service the entire building, required to maintain an operational hvac system; not applied to components with n+1 redundancy

required_ratio_operating_hvac_unit.description: ratio of hvac units, which service an individual tenant unit, required to maintain an operational hvac system; not applied to components with n+1 redundancy

exterior_safety_threshold.description: damage theshold that triggers an exterior safety issue; threshold is defined in terms of the ratio of damaged area to perimeter area of a given tenant unit

interior_safety_threshold.description: damage theshold that triggers an interior safety issue; threshold is defined in terms of the ratio of damaged area to interior area of a given tenant unit

door_access_width_ft.description: width of door access zone, centerlined on the doorway, required for safe access. A safe door access zone must be free of falling hazards

heat_utility.description: string identifier of the type of utility that is used to heat the building; string should match on of the fields in functionality.utilities

building_model.description: general information about the building such as the number of stories and the building area

building_value.description: Total replacement value of the building, in USD

num_stories.description: number of stories in the building, does not include basement levels

area_per_story_sf.description: interior area, in square feet, for each story in the building, starting from the lowest level

ht_per_story_ft.description: elevation height, in feet, for each story in the building, starting from the lowest level

edge_lengths.description: external length of two orthogonal sides of the building, in feet, for each story in the building, starting from the lowest level

struct_bay_area_per_story.description: length of the typical structural bay, from centerline to centerline, in feet, for each story in the building, starting from the lowest level

num_elevators.description: number of elevator shafts in the building

stairs_per_story.description: number of stairways on each story in the building, starting from the lowest level

occupants_per_story.description: total number of occuapnts (persons) that occupy each story of this building, starting from the lowest level

qty_dir_1.description: total number of component units for each component stack in direction 1 of this story

qty_dir_2.description: total number of component units for each component stack in direction 2 of this story

qty_dir_3.description: total number of component units for each component stack in direction 3 (nondirectional) of this story

comp_list.description: fragility ID for each component stack

comp_table.description: various component attributes. Can be populated from the component_attribites.csv database in the static_tables directory

damage.description: simulated damage, simulated repair time, and compoennt attribute data associated with each component's damages state in the building

comp_ds_table.description: various component attributes by damage state. Can be populated from the component_attribites.csv and damage_state_attribute_mapping.csv databases in the static_tables directory

story.description: simulated component damage, broken down by each story in the building

qnt_damaged.description: simulation of the quantity of damaged components in each component damage state

cost.description: simulated repair cost of each component's damage state

worker_days.description: simulated worker days required to repair each component's damage state

qnt_damaged_dir_1.description: simulated number of damaged component damage states associated with damage in direction 1

qnt_damaged_dir_2.description: simulated number of damaged component damage states associated with damage in direction 2

qnt_damaged_dir_3.description: simulated number of damaged component damage states associated with nondirectional damage

num_comps.description: total number of components populated within each tenant unit associated with each damage state

damage_consequences.description: general impedance assessment inputs such as mitigation factors

simulated_replacement.description: simulated replacement time in days for all realizations where replacement is required, NaN = building does not need replaced and is scheduled for repairs. Note: to not consider building replacement, pass in an array of NaNs

repair_cost_ratio_total.description: simulated building repair cost of structural and nonstructural repairs (does not include tenant contents); normalized by the replacement value

repair_cost_ratio_engineering.description: simulated building repair cost of repairs that require engineering redesign; normalized by the replacement value

functionality.description: simulated outputs of the performance based functional recovery methodology

utilities.description: simulated utility downtimes at this building site

tenant_units.description: attributes and functional requirements of each tenant unit in the building

story.description: story where each tenant unit is located

area.description: floor area, in square feet, of the tenant unit

perim_area.description: perimeter area, in square feet, of the tenant unit

occupancy_id.description: unique id key linking each tenant unit to its associated tenant function requirements

exterior.description: tolerance for damage to exterior systems required for tenant function (0 = any damage causes loss of function, 0.999 = everything must be damage for loss of tenant function). Ratio of the perimeter area of severely damaged exterior components within the tenant-unit to the total perimeter area of the tenant unit (i.e., what percent of the exterior walls must be sufficiently damaged to cause tenants to not be able to function in this space).

interior.description: tolerance for damage to interior systems required for tenant function (0 = any damage causes loss of function, 0.999 = everything must be damage for loss of tenant function). Ratio of the interior plan area of severely damaged interior components within the tenant-unit to the total plan area of the tenant unit (i.e., what percent of the interior space must be hindered to cause tenants to not be able to function in this space).

occ_per_elev.description: max number of occupants per elevator allowed for function

is_elevator_required.description: is an operational elevator required for tenant function

is_electrical_required.description: is an operational electrical system required for tenant function

is_water_potable_required.description: is an operational potable water plumbing system required for tenant function

is_water_sanitary_required.description: is an operational sanitary waste plumbing system required for tenant function

is_hvac_ventilation_required.description: is an operational hvac system required for tenant function

is_hvac_heating_required.description: is an operational hvac system required for tenant function

is_hvac_cooling_required.description: is an operational hvac system required for tenant function

is_hvac_exhaust_required.description: is an operational hvac system required for tenant function
